com.example.jamescollerton.internet_fridge

Class HomeScreen

    • com.example.jamescollerton.internet_fridge.HomeScreen

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Loads up its latest instance (presumably from when its been sleeping). Then sets the content view and the toolbar from the XML. Sets all of the setting buttons on the toolbar and the floating action buttons at the bottom of the page. Then initialises all of the buttons on the page.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • floatingActionButtonFunctions

        public void floatingActionButtonFunctions()
        This initialises all of the floating action buttons at the bottom of the page. Eventually this will include a synchronise button and an email button.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        This creates the option menu in the toolbar which can be dropped down to change settings and to access other options. The inflater part inflates the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
        Returns:
        true

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Handle action bar item clicks here. The action bar will automatically handle clicks on the Home/Up button, so long as you specify a parent activity in AndroidManifest.xml. The bottom part is a noinspection SimplifiableIfStatement
        Returns:
        selectedItem An item that has been selected from the options menu.

      • getScreenDimensionsMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getScreenDimensionsMap()
        This is used to return the map of screen dimensions. At the moment it is used by the buttons on the screen in order to set their position relative to the screen size.
        Returns:
        screenDimensionsMap The map of screen dimensions.

      • onStart

        public void onStart()

      • onStop

        public void onStop()
